title: Agropur sans and serif
content:
Having to ID both of these. Thanks!

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20081204093801im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/AgropurSignature_6668.jpg)

 [‹ Does anyone know where to find more fonts of this genre ?](http://web.archive.org/web/20081204093801/http:/www.typophile.com/node/45610 "Go to previous forum topic") [Comic style font, variation on Helvetica ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081204093801/http:/www.typophile.com/node/45621 "Go to next forum topic")
author: elzadra

comments.content: I’m pretty sure the serif is a bold Baskerville, but the G in the sans is bugging me.

Why not taking TheSans right away?

I was just about to suggest that but you beat me, Michel.

<cite>I was just about to suggest that but you beat me, Michel.</cite>

I am not in the competition but I got caught by the “Agropur” (I am from Montreal, too) and I also know that white on black is sometimes tricky. To see better, one can invert. It helps a lot.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20081204093801im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/agropuri_6615.gif)
